qas.question: What caused reform efforts to cease in 1997?
What are two reasons why the economy was not able to progress following the civil war?

answers.text: slumping oil prices and the resumption of armed conflict

qas.question: When did military conflict resume in the Congo?
What organization never supported economic reform efforts?
When did the reform program start?
What was helped by slumping oil prices?
Who did not express interest in economic reforms?

context: Economic reform efforts continued with the support of international organizations, notably <b3_0>the World Bank<b3_0/> and the International Monetary Fund. The reform program came to a halt in <b4_0>June 1997<b4_0/> when <a0_0>civil war<a0_0/> erupted. When <b7_0>Sassou Nguesso<b7_0/> returned to power at the end of the war in <b5_0>October 1997<b5_0/>, he publicly expressed interest in moving forward on economic reforms and privatization and in renewing cooperation with international financial institutions. However, <b6_0>economic progress<b6_0/> was badly hurt by <a1_0>slumping oil prices and the resumption of armed conflict<a1_0/> in <a2_0>December 1998<a2_0/>, which worsened the republic's budget deficit.
